Author: komodoman13#4364
Content: Hey guys, I'm having an issue constructing transactions (for KMD and assetchain coins) via the komodod daemon. Used to be working fine, but as of now, it's returning transactions which fail with the tx-overwinter-expired error. I ran decoderawtransaction on one of them, and it seems to be fine, expiry height being higher than block height. Is there any way to tell the daemon to use a 0 expiry height or anything like that? Thanks

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: @komodoman13 did you compile komodod by yourself or using any prebuilt binary?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
are you using latest bin?
is your chain fully synced?

Author: komodoman13#4364
Content: I think prebuilt, I'm not the one who set it up, but we did update it recently and checked that it's not out of sync

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: what `KMDversion` you see when you use `getinfo` call?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: is the chain that you are tyring to use fully synced?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: post your command and the error output you see

Author: komodoman13#4364
Content: Yes, give or take 1-2 blocks.

Author: komodoman13#4364
Content:
The actual command is a little bit more difficult, I don't use the daemon to broadcast it, but I tried this site:
https://kmdexplorer.io/tx/send

With the raw transaction I got from calling the daemon. The error I got was 
`An error occured:
16: tx-overwinter-expired. Code:-26`

Author: komodoman13#4364
Content: I'm using createrawtransaction and signrawtransaction to create it

Author: komodoman13#4364
Content: Right, so put a hold on all that

Author: komodoman13#4364
Content: Was using an assetchain tx on sending here so the error isn't the actual error I'm getting. My bad. Still failing, but I'll see if I can figure out a reason for that. Sorry about wasting your time.

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: which tx version you see when you decode the raw transaction?

Author: komodoman13#4364
Content: 4, but as I said, the expiry issue is probably not the real error due to me messing up haha, so thanks for the help anyway

Author: Kenyre#1734
Content:
Hi there, i am trying to parse the komodo chain through the komodod api. I've set txindex to 1 in the conf from the beginning and even tried reindexing with txindex set to 1. I however only get transaction id's in the returned block, instead of full transaction objects. Furthermore i see no supported api call to get a whole transaction, the only function documented get's the seperate outputs of a transaction. Lastly  when trying gettransaction (bitcoind's call for returning transactions), i get the following error: "code":-5,"message":"Invalid or non-wallet transaction id"
Anyone any idea how i can get full transactions returned from the API?

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: Use `getrawtransaction`

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: `gettransaction` only references the native wallet.dat

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: https://developers.komodoplatform.com/basic-docs/komodo-api/rawtransactions.html#getrawtransaction

Author: Kenyre#1734
Content: I see, thanks for the info!
